meanings.definition: The quality of being pitiless or merciless.
meanings.sent1: Her pitilessnesses towards the stray animals shocked the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: The pitilessnesses of the dictator left a trail of devastation in the country.
meanings.sent3: Despite her pitilessnesses, she couldn't resist adopting a cute puppy.
meanings.sent4: The pitilessnesses of winter's icy grip seemed to never end.
meanings.sent5: The pitilessnesses of the storm made it impossible to go outside.

meanings.sent1: The pitilessnesses in his eyes revealed a cold heart.
meanings.sent2: She showed pitilessnesses towards those who were suffering.
meanings.sent3: The pitilessnesses of the judge surprised everyone in the courtroom.
meanings.sent4: The pitilessnesses of the situation made her feel isolated and alone.
meanings.sent5: His pitilessnesses towards the beggar made her question his humanity.

meanings.sent1: The pitilessnesses of the punishment shocked the students.
meanings.sent2: The pitilessnesses of war can be seen in the destruction it leaves behind.
meanings.sent3: The pitilessnesses of the chef's critique made the contestant cry.
meanings.sent4: The pitilessnesses of nature can be unforgiving at times.
meanings.sent5: The pitilessnesses of the villain knew no bounds in the story.
